titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the The Waller Project

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

scopecontent.p: An early report entitled The Waller Project, May 1, 1950 - July 1, 1952 (found in Box 1, Folder l), in outlining the materials of value to the Project, listed A) Interviews, B) Written Memoirs, C) Manuscript Materials, and D) Maps of the City of Nashville. Categories A,B, and C have been followed in arranging the materials here, with the addition of a fourth category of Eleanor Graham's research notes. (No maps of Nashville are included in this collection of Waller materials). A perusal of this early report on the Waller Project is suggested to give one a concise listing of resources available and used by Waller and his associates.

row.entry: Reports on the Waller Project, Source Cards for the Johnson Report, Interviews (taped) Done by Donald Davidson and Carole Shelton, Name Index to Interview Cards.
Interview Cards, Narratives of Interviews (typed), Anderson - Moore.

Narratives of Interviews (typed), Polk - Wilson, Narratives of Interviews,- drafts with Corrections, Written Memoirs, Manuscript Materials, Related Printed Material, and Duplicates of Narratives of Interviews, Written Memoirs, and Manuscript Materials.

Eleanor Graham's Research Notes - including the following: Nashville Chronology 1885 - 1897, Listing of ^nrents, 1890 - l899i Listing of Selected Events 1890 - I899 + Weddings, Notecards - bibliography and Nashville 189O -1899, + Misc. Notecards, and Microfilm of Selected Articles, 1890 - 1899.

note.p: The Waller Project, May 1, 1950 - July 1, 1952. Includes a short description of the Project, with an outline of its general objectives, (l)
Report on Preliminary Survey of Printed Materials Pertinent to The Waller Project, by Arthur M. Johnson, Vanderbilt University, July, 1954. (2)
Source Cards for Arthur M. Johnson Report (above).
Interviews Done by Donald Davidson (with the exception of one by Carole Shelton, noted below taped versions)

bibliography.bibref: Adams, Adam G. (“Lep”), of Coral Gables, Fla., formerly of Nashville. Interviewed April 30, 1966 at 410 Fairfax Ave., Nashville.

Frazer, Mrs. George and Mrs. John Reeves, interviewed Feb. 4 1966 at Mrs. Frazer's home, 302 Cornwall Ave., Nashville. (Also present were Mrs. D. Davidson and Prof. Herschel Gower, Vanderbilt University).
Horn, Stanley F., interviewed Jan. 8, 1966.
Keyes, Charlie, interviewed Sept. l6, 1965 by Carole Shelton.
Pope, Lewis S., interviewed Feb. 12, 1966 at his Nashville office in Third National Bank Building.
Reeves, Mrs. John, see Frazer.
Stokes, Walter, Jr., interviewed Mar. 29, 1966 at 410 Fairfax Ave., Nashville.
Williams, Albert, interviewed April 7, 1966 at his home on Murfreesboro Rd.
